LanguageData.SoS.AbandonHomeDesc: Abandon your ship, any colonists on it will be lost.
LanguageData.SoS.LeaveGraveyardDesc: Leave the wreck to its fate.
LanguageData.SoS.BurnUpPlayerDesc: With the loss of the last ship bridge this map can no longer maintain its orbit and will enter the atmosphere in {0} days! \n\nEverything on it will be destroyed!
LanguageData.SoS.BurnUpPlayerPrevented: Building a ship bridge has allowed you to stabilize the orbit.
LanguageData.SoS.BurnUpCountdownTip: This map will enter atmosphere in {0}. Everything on it will be destroyed.
LanguageData.SoS.CombatTooltip:
Shows the enemy ship's distance from your ship, all projectiles and shuttles currently in flight.

RED: laser/canon range
GREEN: plasma range
BLUE: railgun range.
PURPLE: torpedo range
Small colored bars: inaccurate maximum range for large weapons
LanguageData.SoS.CombatRetreatDesc: Try to move away from the enemy ship
LanguageData.SoS.CombatStopDesc: Cut power to your ship's engines
LanguageData.SoS.CombatMaintainDesc: Maintain distance to the enemy ship
LanguageData.SoS.CombatAdvanceDesc: Try to move closer to the enemy ship
LanguageData.SoS.CombatEscapeDesc: Flee from battle, leaving behind anyone aboard the enemy ship
LanguageData.SoS.CombatAbandonPawns: WARNING!\n\nFleeing the enemy ship will leave behind any of your colonists still on board!
LanguageData.SoS.CombatShieldBroken: Our shield has broken due to lack of heat capacity!
LanguageData.SoS.CombatShieldBrokenEnemy: Enemy shield has broken due to lack of heat capacity!
LanguageData.SoS.CombatPodDestroyedPlayer: Your shuttle was destroyed by enemy point defense! If any crew survived, their ejector seats will take them back to your ship.
LanguageData.SoS.CombatPodDestroyedEnemy: Enemy shuttle was destroyed by your point defense!
LanguageData.SoS.WithdrawShipDesc: Withdraw this ship from the battle
LanguageData.SoS.CombatConfirmWithdraw: Withdraw this ship to the graveyard? If you lose or flee, the enemy ship will attack your graveyard.
LanguageData.SoS.WrecksPreventMove: Can not move with wrecks on map!
LanguageData.SoS.RemoveWrecksDesc: Remove all wrecks from your map, they will be destroyed.
LanguageData.SoS.RemoveWrecksConfirm: Remove all wrecks from your map?\n\nThis will remove any ship or wreck that can not move on its own! They will be destroyed by the debris field.
LanguageData.SoS.WithdrawWrecksConfirm: Withdraw all wrecks to the graveyard? If you lose or flee, the enemy ship will attack your graveyard. If you win, the wrecks can be retrieved with the salvage bay for a minor amount of fuel.
LanguageData.SoS.ScuttleShipDesc: Launches all escape pods to selected destination on the planet.
LanguageData.SoS.ScuttleShipPods: Can not abandon ship with pods in transit to/from it!
LanguageData.SoS.HoldFireDesc: Stop all connected ship-to-ship weapons from firing on enemy ship
LanguageData.SoS.TogglePointDefense: Stop all connected ship-to-ship weapons from firing on enemy ship
LanguageData.SoS.TogglePointDefenseDesc: Stop all connected ship-to-ship weapons from firing on enemy ship
LanguageData.SoS.EnemyShipRetreating: Enemy ship is attempting to retreat!
LanguageData.SoS.EnemyShipAdrift: Enemy ship has started to drift and is slowly losing orbit!
LanguageData.SoS.ReturnShipDesc: Move this ship back to your stable orbit
LanguageData.SoS.CaptureShipDesc: Move this ship to your map
LanguageData.SoS.LaunchFailPawns: Non player pawn found on ship: {0}, takeoff disabled.
LanguageData.SoS.MoveFailImmobile: No pilot, not enough fuel or RCS thrusters!
LanguageData.SoS.MoveFailFaction: Ship from another faction next to target area. Move aborted.
LanguageData.SoS.MoveWreckCommandDesc: Reposition a wreck on your map
LanguageData.SoS.MoveWreckFlipCommandDesc: Reposition and flip a wreck on your map
LanguageData.SoS.MoveWreckRotCommandDesc: Reposition and rotate a wreck counter clockwise on your map
LanguageData.SoS.SalvageCommandDesc: Retrieve a wreck from target map {0}
LanguageData.SoS.SalvageBeamDesc: Retrieve loose, free-floating debris from target map {0}
LanguageData.SoS.SalvageStablizeDesc: Stabilize the orbit of {0}. This requires enough salvage bays and will consume fuel in your engines.
LanguageData.SoS.SalvageStablizeConfirm: Stabilize the orbit of {0}. This requires enough salvage bays and will consume {1} chemfuel equivalent in your engines.
LanguageData.SoS.SalvageDisabled: In ship battle or enemy pawns present!
LanguageData.SoS.SalvageAbandonConfirm: Are you sure you want to discard the target?\nEverything connected to or on it will burn up in the atmosphere!
LanguageData.SoS.SalvageBridge: Can not move intact ships with the salvage bay, capture or destroy the bridge.
LanguageData.SoS.SalvageNoSpace: Not enough space on salvage bay.
LanguageData.SoS.SalvageEnemiesPresent: Use salvage bay to claim after all enemies have been defeated.
LanguageData.SoS.ClaimWrecksCommandDesc: Claim all wrecks on this map
LanguageData.SoS.RemoveWrecksCommandDesc: Remove target wreck from this map
LanguageData.SoS.PlaceOnShipHull: Must place on owned ship hull.
LanguageData.SoS.EnginePlaceRotation: Engines must face the same way!
LanguageData.SoS.TradeTradeDecline: {0} does not want to trade with you due to your notoriety.
LanguageData.SoS.PirateTradeDemand: Demand they hand over their cargo (This is an act of piracy!)
LanguageData.SoS.TradeTryingToFlee: has closed comms and is trying to flee!
LanguageData.SoS.PirateHail: A pirate ship is attempting to hail you.\n
LanguageData.SoS.PirateHailPirate: Surely they know of your notoriety.
LanguageData.SoS.PirateHailNormal: If you do not answer they will most likely attack.
LanguageData.SoS.PirateTalkPirate: Your notoriety is known to them and they are asking if you want to trade.
LanguageData.SoS.PirateTalkParley: They are willing to trade with you now.
LanguageData.SoS.PirateTalkNormal:
They demand you hand over valuables in worth of {0} silver.

If you do not meet their demands quickly, they will eventually attack.

You can try to use the ancient pirate code of parley but that might anger them and they will attack immediately.
LanguageData.SoS.PirateParleyFailDesc: Your attempt to parley with the pirates failed. They are beginning their attack.
LanguageData.SoS.PirateParleyWinDesc: Somehow you managed to persuade the pirates not to attack your ship.
LanguageData.SoS.PirateAttacksBetrayDesc: Seems there is no honor among thieves.
LanguageData.SoS.PirateAttacksPayDesc: The pirates have decided that your payment was not good enough and are beginning their attack.
LanguageData.SoS.PirateAttacksWaitDesc: The pirates have decided they will wait no longer and are beginning their attack.
LanguageData.SoS.ReportNeedPilot: Ship requires either a pilot or an AI core.
LanguageData.SoS.NeedsMoreFuel: Ship has {0} units of fuel, but requires {1} in engine fuel tanks.
LanguageData.SoS.NeedsMorePower: Ship requires {0} Wd of stored power.
LanguageData.SoS.NeedsMoreJTEngines: Ship requires more JT engines due to its size.
LanguageData.SoS.PlanetLeaveDesc: Leave this planet behind and find a new rimworld to settle
LanguageData.SoS.ToggleShieldsDesc: Activate or deactivate your ship's shields
LanguageData.SoS.ToggleCloakDesc: Activate or deactivate your ship's cloaking device
LanguageData.SoS.ShipInfoDesc: Shows ship statistics and readiness for interstellar travel.
LanguageData.SoS.RenameDesc: Give this ship a new name
LanguageData.SoS.MoveDesc: Move the ship elsewhere on this map
LanguageData.SoS.MoveRotNo: Ship has non-rotatable, non-even sided buildings!
LanguageData.SoS.MoveFailDesc: Ship move failed! Recheck your ship and reload if things are out of place or broken. This is most often caused by modded buildings that do not despawn properly.\nFailed by moving: {0}
LanguageData.SoS.MoveFailRCS: Not enough RCS thrusters to move ship, required {0}
LanguageData.SoS.MoveFailFuel: Not enough fuel to move ship, required {0} fuel
LanguageData.SoS.MoveFailPilot: Ship requires a pilot to move.
LanguageData.SoS.RebuildDesc: Places blueprints for destroyed buildings on this ship.
LanguageData.SoS.QuestPillarADesc: Attempt to engage the ancient terraforming station and recover an archotech pillar
LanguageData.SoS.QuestPillarBDesc: Attack the mechanoid moon base and attempt to recover an archotech pillar.\n\nThis will also provoke a mechanoid warship!
LanguageData.SoS.scanRegionDesc: Reveal an area on the planet's surface.
LanguageData.SoS.ScanMapDesc: View a single map from orbit
LanguageData.SoS.ScanMapStopDesc: Stop observing {0}. This will cause the map to de-spawn unless colonists are present.
LanguageData.SoS.ToggleEnginesDesc: Engage ship engines to clear hazards.
LanguageData.SoS.ToggleDockDesc: Extend or retract the airlock extender up to 3 tiles away
LanguageData.SoS.UnfoldBlocked: Must place free of obstructions or other extendables.
LanguageData.SoS.HeatWithPowerDesc: Use power for heating when not enough heat is present in the network.
LanguageData.SoS.PurgeHeatDesc: Eject molten silver into space to rapidly lower your ship's stored heat.\n\nThis will cause your shields to drop!
LanguageData.SoS.HeatPurgeDesc: Begin venting coolant from heatsinks. All shields, weapons, and cloaks on this heat network will shut down, and heatsinks will vent heat five times as quickly.\n\nThis process depletes coolant and reduces the overall capacity of the heat network, and cannot be canceled once it has begun. Outside of combat, depleted capacity will slowly recover.
LanguageData.SoS.HeatPurgeNotEnough: Not enough heat in network for purge
LanguageData.SoS.CloakBroken: Cloak disengaged due to heat depleetion
LanguageData.SoS.HeatNotConnected: Not connected to a thermal networ
LanguageData.SoS.TurretNotInShipCombat: Warning: Turret will not fire because you are not in ship combat.
LanguageData.SoS.TurretInPointDefense: Warning: Turret will not target the enemy ship because it is set to Point Defense mode
LanguageData.SoS.TurretExtractTorpedoDesc: Unloads the current torpedoes so they can be replaced with different ammunition.
LanguageData.SoS.TurretExtractOneTorpedoDesc: Unloads just one torpedo so it can be replaced with different ammunition.
LanguageData.SoS.TurretOptimalRangeDesc: Enable to only fire on targets within optimal range
LanguageData.SoS.TurretPointDefenseDesc: Use this turret to intercept incoming torpedoes and shuttles
LanguageData.SoS.TorpedoAllowedDesc: Toggle to prevent or allow firing of this type of torpedo.
LanguageData.SoS.CannotFireDueToHeat: {0} cannot fire: not enough heatsink capacity
LanguageData.SoS.FoamFillDesc: Fill destroyed areas of your ship with hullfoam from its distributors.
LanguageData.SoS.FoamFillDisabled: Nothing to fill or no fuel in distributors.
LanguageData.SoS.ReactorOverdriveDesc: Increase reactor output, at the cost of increased heat production and fuel consumption.
LanguageData.SoS.ReactorOverdrive2Desc: Greatly increase reactor output, at the cost of increased heat production and fuel consumption. Increases instability, risking fire and radiation leaks.
LanguageData.SoS.ReactorOverdrive3Desc: Vastly increase reactor output, at the cost of increased heat production and fuel consumption. Increases instability, risking fire and radiation leaks.
LanguageData.SoS.BlueprintFailed: Blueprint placement failed! Area must support heavy construction and be clear of non-owned objects and mountain roof.
LanguageData.SoS.BlueprintPlace1Desc: Place ship plating and outer hull blueprints. Construct this before placing ship hull!
LanguageData.SoS.BlueprintPlace2Desc: Place ship hull blueprints. Construct this before placing interior blueprints!
LanguageData.SoS.BlueprintPlace3Desc: Place ship interior blueprints. Construct frame and hull blueprints before placing these!
LanguageData.SoS.DamagedReactorHurtsPawn: {0} is suffering radiation burns from a damaged reactor!
LanguageData.SoS.SpawnHologramDesc: Assemble a formgel through which this consciousness can affect the world
LanguageData.SoS.DespawnHologramDesc: Destroy the formgel controlled by this device. Breeding a new mechanite swarm to replace it will take one day
LanguageData.SoS.RenameAIDesc: Give this AI a new name
LanguageData.SoS.InstallConsciousnessDesc: Install a consciousness into this device
LanguageData.SoS.InstallCoreDesc: Order your colonists to install an AI core in this device
LanguageData.SoS.HologramColorDesc: Choose the color for this mind's formgel
LanguageData.SoS.EquipRangedDesc: Equip this hologram with a ranged laser attack
LanguageData.SoS.EquipMeleeDesc: Equip this hologram with a blade and an energy shield
LanguageData.SoS.ResurrectBrainDesc: Use a resurrector mech serum to construct a new body for this consciousness
LanguageData.SoS.ArchotechGoodwillPlus: Psychically increase goodwill (+10, costs {0} field strength)
LanguageData.SoS.ArchotechGoodwillMinus: Psychically decrease goodwill (-10, costs {0} field strength)
LanguageData.SoS.ArchotechSootheDesc: Perform a psychic soothe on one map (costs {0} field strength)
LanguageData.SoS.ArchotechShockDesc: Inflict psychic shock on one pawn (costs {0} field strength)
LanguageData.SoS.ArchotechInsanityDesc: Inflict psychic insanity on one pawn (costs {0} field strength)
LanguageData.SoS.ArchotechPsylinkDesc: Grant a level of psylink to one pawn (costs {0} field strength)
LanguageData.SoS.ArchotechSoulLinkDesc: Connect one pawn to this archotech spore. If the subject's body is destroyed, the psychic pattern can be directly downloaded into an afterlife casket, exactly as it was before death. (costs {0} field strength)
LanguageData.SoS.ArchotechSoulDownloadDesc: Download {0}'s consciousness into an empty afterlife casket.
LanguageData.SoS.ArchotechOptimizeMatterDesc: Automatically convert standard hull to archotech hull in a slowly widening radius. This will not affect large structures such as heatsinks or shield generators.
LanguageData.SoS.ArchotechGiftParticlesDesc: Automatically accept and convert spore rewards to exotic particles
LanguageData.SoS.ArchotechDemandGiftDesc: Demand an immediate gift from your archotech spore. This will result in a stacking -40 mood penalty!
LanguageData.SoS.ArchotechEvolveDesc: Evolve your archotech spore into a true archotech, and usher in a new age for this world.\n\nThis will end the game!
LanguageData.SoS.ArchotechMoodLowDesc: Your archotech spore's mood is low, and it may decide to start playing "pranks" on your crew.\n\nThe spore's mood can be improved slowly by having colonists meditate nearby, or quickly by sacrificing prisoners to it.
LanguageData.SoS.ArchotechMoodLowNoRoyDesc: Your archotech spore's mood is low, and it may decide to start playing "pranks" on your crew.\n\nThe spore's mood can be improved by sacrificing prisoners' brains to it.
LanguageData.SoS.ArchoAnimalSuddenDeath: By some cosmic event an archo animal appeared for a brief moment only to vanish soon after. Maybe it is a sign of things to come.
LanguageData.SoS.ArchoAnimalSporeDeath: Without an Archotech to guide it, {0} has perished.
LanguageData.SoS.ArcholifeChangeSkinDesc: This creature seems able to change shape at will, but only between a few discrete forms.
LanguageData.SoS.MechanitesInHomeAreaDesc: Disassembler mechanites have infested the home area.
LanguageData.SoS.ShuttleRetreat: Your shuttle is retreating due to damaged hull!
LanguageData.SoS.EnemyShuttleRetreat: Enemy shuttle is retreating due to damaged hull!
LanguageData.SoS.ShuttleRetreatFuel: Your shuttle is retreating due to low fuel!
LanguageData.SoS.EnemyShuttleRetreatFuel: Enemy shuttle is retreating due to low fuel!
LanguageData.SoS.ShuttleOutOfTorps: Your shuttle is out of torpedoes and has begun retreating!
LanguageData.SoS.EnemyShuttleOutOfTorps: Enemy shuttle is out of torpedoes and has begun retreating!
LanguageData.SoS.ShuttleMissionBoardingDesc: Send this shuttle to board the enemy ship. It will be vulnerable to point-defense weaponry. If the enemy has active engines, the shuttle will take longer to arrive.
LanguageData.SoS.ShuttleMissionBoardingDisabled: Shuttle under roof and not on suitable bay!
LanguageData.SoS.ShuttleMissionBoardingWarnDesc: WARNING: Enemy ship has active engines and might not have room to land on!\nSend this shuttle to board the enemy ship. It will be vulnerable to point-defense weaponry. If the enemy has active engines, the shuttle will take longer to arrive.
LanguageData.SoS.ShuttleMissionBoardingReturnDesc: Send this shuttle back to your ship. If enemy point-defense weapons remain online, it will be vulnerable to attack.
LanguageData.SoS.ShuttleMissionInterceptDesc: Send this shuttle to intercept incoming torpedoes and enemy shuttlecraft.\n\nIt will continue its mission until it runs low on fuel or is sufficiently damaged, or you recall it manually.
LanguageData.SoS.ShuttleMissionStrafeDesc: Send this shuttle to strafe the enemy ship with its turrets. It will be vulnerable to point-defense weaponry. If the enemy has active engines, the shuttle will take longer to arrive.\n\nIt will continue its mission until it runs low on fuel or is sufficiently damaged, or you recall it manually.
LanguageData.SoS.ShuttleMissionBombDesc: Send this shuttle to fire torpedoes from close range. It will be extremely vulnerable to point-defense weaponry, but its torpedoes will not be. If the enemy has active engines, the shuttle will take longer to arrive.\n\nIt will continue its mission until it runs low on fuel runs out of torpedoes, is sufficiently damaged, or you recall it manually.
LanguageData.SoS.RetreatAtHealthDesc: This shuttle will automatically retreat when its health drops below this percentage.
LanguageData.SoS.CancelBoarding: Cancel boarding action? Your shuttle will return to your ship.
LanguageData.SoS.NoHardpoints: Shuttle does not have enough hardpoints for this turret.
LanguageData.SoS.NotEnoughCargoSpace: This upgrade would reduce cargo capacity below zero.
LanguageData.SoS.HoverJump.Desc: Launch and land in the same tile, at the cost of 5 fuel
LanguageData.SoS.TargetShuttlesDesc: Choose where shuttles on strafing and bombing missions should aim
LanguageData.SoS.ToggleFieldDesc: Allow pawns and vehicles to pass through this region of permeable hull.
LanguageData.SoSRestoreHullDesc: Construct new hull in place of wreckage
LanguageData.SoS.UnDockWarning: Warning: Moving a ship while docked will release all docking clamps.
LanguageData.SoS.ExpelSuperheatedAirDesc: Use this vent to expel superheated air from the room. The process will damage your ship's life-support systems for one point per four tiles in the room, split evenly.
